definition: to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: A revision of that English book will be published in May this year.
sentences.chinese: 那本英文書的修訂版將於今年五月出版。

sentences.english: The vendor issues 'hard copy' of the appropriate revisions to the Code.
sentences.chinese: 供應商發放了規範文件修訂版的“硬拷貝”。

sentences.english: This happened because an attempt was made to replicate differing revisions of the same document.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲想要複製同一個文檔的不同修訂版。

sentences.english: The latest edition of the reference document and revised edition thereafter are applicable to this code.
sentences.chinese: 引用文件最新版本，以及其後修訂版均適用於本規程。

sentences.english: Congress "normally" passes a revision of WRDA every two years.
sentences.chinese: 國會“通常”每兩年批准一項水資源開發法修訂版。

sentences.english: Masonry Level 3 Trainee Guide, 2004 Revision, Perfect Bound.
sentences.chinese: 圬工職業水平3，練習指導，2004修訂版，平裝。

definition: to revise and enlarge (a book)/to augment a purchase order
variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
(often used in book or chapter titles) general introduction/overview
see also/please refer to/compare (cf.)/to consult for reference
clauses and sub-clauses (in formal document)/entry (in a dictionary, encyclopedia etc)
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
